<article>
  <header class="mb-14">
    <h1 class="!my-0 pb-2.5">Starting My Blog Journey in 2025: Building a Second Brain and Sharing What I Learn</h1>

    
    <div class="text-xs antialiased opacity-60">
      
      <time>Jan 7, 2025</time>
      
      
      
      
    </div>
    
  </header>

  <section><p><img src="/images/Pasted%20image%2020250108062918.png" alt="Pasted image 20250108062918.png"></p>
<p><img src="/images/Pasted%20image%2020250108063711.png" alt="Pasted image 20250108063711.png"></p>
<p><img src="/images/Pasted%20image%2020250108064310.png" alt="Pasted image 20250108064310.png"></p>
<h2 id="introduction">Introduction</h2>
<p>After watching an inspiring video about starting a blog in 2024, I realized something profound: &ldquo;my mind is for having ideas, not holding them.&rdquo; This quote from Tiago Forte&rsquo;s &ldquo;Building a Second Brain&rdquo; hit me hard. We&rsquo;re drowning in information but starving for wisdom. That&rsquo;s why I decided to start this blog—not just as another voice on the internet, but as a way to process, organize, and share my journey of learning and growth.</p>
<h2 id="main-points">Main Points</h2>
<h3 id="1-why-im-really-starting-this-blog">1. Why I&rsquo;m Really Starting This Blog</h3>
<p>I&rsquo;m not doing this just to add to the noise. This blog is for my children, my grandchildren, my friends, and family. It&rsquo;s for anyone who might resonate with my singular perspective. As the video pointed out, &ldquo;some people may only be reached because of your singular perspective.&rdquo; That thought gives me courage to start sharing, even though I&rsquo;m not an expert in most topics I&rsquo;ll discuss.</p>
<h3 id="2-my-technical-setup-the-insane-part">2. My Technical Setup (The Insane Part)</h3>
<p>I&rsquo;m building what I call an &ldquo;insane blogging pipeline,&rdquo; inspired by the video&rsquo;s technical approach:</p>
<ul>
<li><strong>Obsidian</strong>: My digital garden where everything starts. It&rsquo;s truly &ldquo;the most amazing notes application in the entire world&rdquo;</li>
<li><strong>Hugo</strong>: Transforms my markdown notes into a beautiful website</li>
<li><strong>GitHub</strong>: Treats my ideas like code, allowing others to contribute</li>
<li><strong>Python Scripts</strong>: Automating the boring stuff</li>
<li><strong>Webhooks</strong>: Making everything seamless</li>
</ul>
<p>But here&rsquo;s the thing—you don&rsquo;t need all this to start. I chose this setup because I love tinkering with technology, but as mentioned in the video, you could start with simpler options like WordPress or an AI website builder.</p>
<h3 id="3-my-content-philosophy">3. My Content Philosophy</h3>
<p>Following Tiago Forte&rsquo;s principles:</p>
<ul>
<li>Capture everything interesting</li>
<li>Organize thoughtfully</li>
<li>Distill information into wisdom</li>
<li>Create and share generously</li>
</ul>
<p>The video emphasized that &ldquo;we only know what we make.&rdquo; So, I&rsquo;m committing to not just consuming information but expressing and sharing what I learn. Every tutorial I follow, every book I read, every problem I solve—it all has potential to become valuable content for someone else.</p>
<h2 id="key-takeaways">Key Takeaways</h2>
<ul>
<li>Start writing even if you think you don&rsquo;t have anything to say</li>
<li>Your perspective matters more than you think</li>
<li>Build systems that make sharing frictionless</li>
<li>Focus on serving others with your knowledge</li>
<li>Create value by connecting ideas in unique ways</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="conclusion">Conclusion</h2>
<p>This blog is my attempt to &ldquo;be violent and original&rdquo; with my work, as Tiago Forte would say. It&rsquo;s not just about publishing content—it&rsquo;s about processing my thoughts, sharing my journey, and hopefully helping others along the way.</p>
<p>I want this to be more than just another tech blog. It&rsquo;s a digital garden where I&rsquo;ll grow my ideas in public, share my learning journey, and hopefully connect with others who are on similar paths. Whether you&rsquo;re here to learn about technical setups, personal knowledge management, or just to see how someone else thinks about the world, I hope you&rsquo;ll find something valuable.</p>
<p>Ready to join me on this journey? I&rsquo;ll be sharing my setup process, learning experiences, and insights along the way. And remember, in 2025, the best time to start blogging isn&rsquo;t tomorrow—it&rsquo;s today.</p>
<hr>
<h2 id="post-writing-checklist">Post-Writing Checklist</h2>
<ul>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Engaging title</li>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Clear structure</li>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Examples included</li>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> SEO keywords</li>
<li><input disabled="" type="checkbox"> Images/media planned</li>
<li><input checked="" disabled="" type="checkbox"> Call to action</li>
<li><input disabled="" type="checkbox"> Proofread</li>
<li><input disabled="" type="checkbox"> Meta description</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="additional-notes">Additional Notes</h2>
<ul>
<li>Add screenshots of my Obsidian setup</li>
<li>Include diagram of my blogging pipeline</li>
<li>Link to resources about Second Brain methodology</li>
<li>Share my Obsidian templates</li>
</ul>
</section>

    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

    rel="noopener"
    target="_blank"
    >hugo-paper</a
  >
</footer>

  </body>
</html>
```

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

<article>
  <header class="mb-14">
    <h1 class="!my-0 pb-2.5">The AI Revolution in Software Development: A 2025 Perspective</h1>

    
    <div class="text-xs antialiased opacity-60">
      
      <time>Jan 8, 2025</time>
      
      
      
      
    </div>
    
  </header>

  <section><p>The landscape of software development is undergoing a fundamental transformation. As we navigate through 2025, artificial intelligence isn&rsquo;t just another tool in a developer&rsquo;s toolkit—it&rsquo;s reshaping the entire development ecosystem. This shift represents what systems theorists call a <strong>paradigm transition</strong>: a moment when established patterns give way to new frameworks of understanding and operation.</p>
<h2 id="the-new-development-paradigm">The New Development Paradigm</h2>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>AI-Enhanced Development</strong>: A software creation approach that combines human creativity and strategic thinking with AI-powered automation and assistance to accelerate and improve the development process.</p>
</blockquote>
<p>The relationship between developers and AI has evolved from simple code completion to what we might call <em>collaborative intelligence</em>. This partnership manifests in several key dimensions:</p>
<h3 id="1-code-generation-and-optimization">1. Code Generation and Optimization</h3>
<p>Modern AI coding assistants have transcended basic autocomplete functionality. They now serve as intelligent collaborators that can:</p>
<ul>
<li>Generate entire functions and modules based on natural language descriptions</li>
<li>Identify and refactor inefficient code patterns in real-time</li>
<li>Suggest architectural improvements based on project-wide analysis</li>
<li>Create test cases and documentation automatically</li>
</ul>
<p>For instance, a developer at Spotify recently shared how their team reduced the time needed to create new microservices by 60% using AI-powered scaffolding tools. The AI doesn&rsquo;t just write code—it understands system architecture and best practices.</p>
<h3 id="2-the-evolution-of-developer-workflows">2. The Evolution of Developer Workflows</h3>
<p>Traditional development workflows are being reimagined through the lens of human-AI collaboration. Consider these transformative changes:</p>
<p><strong>Before AI Integration</strong>:</p>
<ol>
<li>Write code from scratch</li>
<li>Debug through trial and error</li>
<li>Search documentation manually</li>
<li>Write tests after implementation</li>
</ol>
<p><strong>Current AI-Enhanced Workflow</strong>:</p>
<ol>
<li>Describe desired functionality in natural language</li>
<li>Review and refine AI-generated implementations</li>
<li>Receive proactive suggestions and optimizations</li>
<li>Simultaneously generate tests and documentation</li>
</ol>
<h3 id="3-knowledge-democratization">3. Knowledge Democratization</h3>
<p>One of the most profound impacts of AI in development has been the democratization of programming knowledge. <strong>Knowledge scaffolding</strong>—the process of building understanding through layered learning—has been dramatically accelerated by AI tools that can:</p>
<ul>
<li>Explain complex code in plain language</li>
<li>Provide contextual learning resources</li>
<li>Generate interactive examples</li>
<li>Offer personalized learning paths</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="impact-on-development-teams">Impact on Development Teams</h2>
<p>The integration of AI has catalyzed significant changes in team dynamics and organizational structures. We&rsquo;re witnessing the emergence of what I call <em>adaptive development teams</em>—groups that flexibly combine human expertise with AI capabilities.</p>
<h3 id="shifting-role-definitions">Shifting Role Definitions</h3>
<p>Traditional development roles are evolving into more strategic positions:</p>
<ul>
<li>Junior developers now focus more on system understanding and architecture rather than routine coding</li>
<li>Senior developers increasingly serve as AI prompt engineers and system architects</li>
<li>New roles like &ldquo;AI Development Strategist&rdquo; are emerging to optimize AI tool integration</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="productivity-metrics-in-the-ai-era">Productivity Metrics in the AI Era</h3>
<p>The metrics for measuring developer productivity are evolving. Traditional measures like lines of code or commits per day are giving way to more nuanced indicators:</p>
<ul>
<li>Quality of system architecture decisions</li>
<li>Effectiveness of AI tool utilization</li>
<li>Impact of code optimizations</li>
<li>Speed of knowledge transfer within teams</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="challenges-and-considerations">Challenges and Considerations</h2>
<p>While the benefits are substantial, the integration of AI in development comes with important considerations:</p>
<h3 id="1-quality-control-and-review">1. Quality Control and Review</h3>
<p><em>How do we ensure AI-generated code meets our standards?</em> This question has led to the development of new quality assurance practices:</p>
<ul>
<li>Automated code quality metrics specifically designed for AI-generated code</li>
<li>Human-AI paired review processes</li>
<li>Systematic testing of AI suggestions against established patterns</li>
</ul>
<h3 id="2-skill-development-and-adaptation">2. Skill Development and Adaptation</h3>
<p>The skills needed to excel in this new paradigm are evolving. Successful developers now need to master:</p>
<ul>
<li>Prompt engineering for optimal AI interaction</li>
<li>System architecture and design patterns</li>
<li>Collaborative workflows with AI tools</li>
<li>Critical evaluation of AI-generated solutions</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="looking-forward">Looking Forward</h2>
<p>As we move further into 2025, several trends are shaping the future of AI-enhanced development:</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p><strong>Contextualized Code Generation</strong>: AI systems are becoming more adept at understanding project-specific contexts and conventions</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Intelligent Architecture Design</strong>: AI tools are beginning to assist with high-level system design decisions</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Automated Optimization</strong>: Real-time performance optimization and refactoring are becoming standard features</p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Enhanced Learning Integration</strong>: AI systems are getting better at helping developers understand and learn from the code they interact with</p>
</li>
</ol>
<h2 id="key-takeaways">Key Takeaways</h2>
<p>The integration of AI into software development represents more than just a technological advancement—it&rsquo;s a fundamental shift in how we approach the creation of software. Success in this new era requires:</p>
<ul>
<li>Embracing AI as a collaborative partner rather than just a tool</li>
<li>Developing new skills focused on system-level thinking and AI interaction</li>
<li>Adapting team structures and workflows to leverage AI capabilities effectively</li>
<li>Maintaining a balance between automation and human oversight</li>
</ul>
<p>As we continue to navigate this transformation, the most successful teams will be those that find the right balance between human creativity and AI capabilities, creating a symbiotic relationship that enhances both the development process and its outcomes.</p>
<p>The future of software development is not about AI replacing developers—it&rsquo;s about creating a more powerful combination of human insight and machine capability. As we move forward, this partnership will continue to evolve, opening new possibilities for what we can create and how we can create it.</p>
</section>

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

<article>
  <header class="mb-14">
    <h1 class="!my-0 pb-2.5">The Architecture of SaaS Success A Systems Approach to Building Sustainable Software Businesses</h1>

    
    <div class="text-xs antialiased opacity-60">
      
      <time>Jan 10, 2025</time>
      
      
      
      
    </div>
    
  </header>

  <section><blockquote>
<p><strong>Core Thesis</strong>: Creating a successful SaaS business requires understanding the intricate interplay between four fundamental systems: market dynamics, product evolution, customer acquisition mechanisms, and value delivery networks.</p>
</blockquote>
<h2 id="i-systems-level-overview">I. Systems-Level Overview</h2>
<p>Before diving into specifics, let&rsquo;s understand the <strong>meta-framework</strong> that governs successful SaaS businesses:</p>
<ol>
<li><em>Market Intelligence System</em>: The continuous feedback loop between market research, validation, and strategic positioning</li>
<li><em>Product Development Ecosystem</em>: The iterative cycle of building, measuring, and learning</li>
<li><em>Growth Engine</em>: The integrated network of marketing, sales, and acquisition channels</li>
<li><em>Value Retention Framework</em>: The mechanisms that ensure sustained customer success and loyalty</li>
</ol>
<h2 id="ii-market-intelligence-system-deep-dive">II. Market Intelligence System: Deep Dive</h2>
<h3 id="understanding-market-dynamics-through-systematic-validation">Understanding Market Dynamics Through <strong>Systematic Validation</strong></h3>
<p>The foundation of SaaS success lies in developing what I call a &ldquo;validation framework&rdquo; - a structured approach to market understanding that operates across three dimensions:</p>
<p><em>First Dimension: Audience Architecture</em></p>
<ul>
<li><strong>Ideal Customer Profile (ICP) Mapping</strong>: Moving beyond basic demographics to understand behavioral patterns, psychological drivers, and contextual needs</li>
<li><strong>Pain Point Topology</strong>: Creating a structured map of customer challenges, rated by intensity, frequency, and current solution adequacy</li>
</ul>
<p><em>Second Dimension: Competitive Intelligence</em></p>
<p>Copy</p>
<p><code>Market Position Matrix: Value Proposition │ Price Point │ Feature Set │ Customer Segment</code></p>
<p><em>Third Dimension: Value Proposition Engineering</em></p>
<blockquote>
<p><strong>Value Proposition</strong>: The unique intersection between your solution&rsquo;s capabilities and your target market&rsquo;s most pressing needs, expressed in terms of concrete outcomes.</p>
</blockquote>
<h2 id="iii-product-development-ecosystem">III. Product Development Ecosystem</h2>
<h3 id="the-iterative-evolution-paradigm">The <strong>Iterative Evolution</strong> Paradigm</h3>
<p>Product development in SaaS operates as a complex adaptive system, characterized by:</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p><strong>MVP Architecture</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><em>Core Value Delivery</em>: The minimal feature set that solves the primary pain point</li>
<li><em>Feedback Integration Mechanisms</em>: Systems for capturing and processing user insights</li>
<li><em>Iteration Velocity</em>: The speed at which you can implement and validate changes</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Feature Prioritization Framework</strong></p>
<p>Copy</p>
<p><code>Priority = (User Value × Strategic Alignment) / Implementation Complexity</code></p>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Technology Stack Selection Matrix</strong> Consider:</p>
<ul>
<li><em>Scalability Coefficient</em>: Growth capacity vs. current needs</li>
<li><em>Maintenance Overhead</em>: Long-term support requirements</li>
<li><em>Integration Capability</em>: API ecosystem compatibility</li>
</ul>
</li>
</ol>
<h2 id="iv-growth-engine-architecture">IV. Growth Engine Architecture</h2>
<h3 id="building-systematic-customer-acquisition">Building Systematic Customer Acquisition</h3>
<p>The growth engine of a SaaS business operates through multiple integrated channels:</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p><strong>Content Ecosystem Development</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><em>Value-First Content Architecture</em>: Creating multi-layered content that serves different stages of the buyer journey</li>
<li><em>Distribution Network Design</em>: Building systematic approaches to content amplification</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Digital Presence Optimization</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><em>Search Engine Visibility Framework</em>: Moving beyond basic SEO to create comprehensive digital footprints</li>
<li><em>Social Ecosystem Integration</em>: Building presence across platforms where your ICP congregates</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Sales System Engineering</strong></p>
<p>Copy</p>
<p><code>Customer Journey Map: Awareness → Consideration → Evaluation → Decision → Success</code></p>
</li>
</ol>
<h2 id="v-value-retention-framework">V. Value Retention Framework</h2>
<h3 id="engineering-customer-success">Engineering Customer Success</h3>
<p>The final system focuses on creating sustainable value delivery mechanisms:</p>
<ol>
<li>
<p><strong>Customer Success Architecture</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><em>Onboarding Experience Design</em>: Creating systematic approaches to initial value delivery</li>
<li><em>Success Metrics Framework</em>: Developing measurable indicators of customer value realization</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Community Building Systems</strong></p>
<ul>
<li><em>Engagement Loop Design</em>: Creating self-reinforcing cycles of community participation</li>
<li><em>Value Exchange Mechanisms</em>: Facilitating multi-directional value flow between customers</li>
</ul>
</li>
<li>
<p><strong>Feedback Integration Framework</strong></p>
<p>Copy</p>
<p><code>Collect → Analyze → Prioritize → Implement → Validate</code></p>
</li>
</ol>
<h2 id="conclusion-the-systems-integration-perspective">Conclusion: The Systems Integration Perspective</h2>
<p>Success in SaaS requires understanding how these systems interact and reinforce each other. The key is not just building each system in isolation, but rather understanding their interconnections and managing them as a unified whole.</p>
<p><em>Remember</em>: The most successful SaaS businesses are those that create positive feedback loops between these systems, where improvements in one area naturally lead to enhancements in others.</p>
</section>

      href="https://blog.ramunasnognys.tech/tags/example"

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

    href="https://blog.ramunasnognys.tech/tags/ai-tools/index.xml"
    title=""
  />
  

  
  <link rel="canonical" href="https://blog.ramunasnognys.tech/tags/ai-tools/" />
  
  
</head>

  <body class="text-black duration-200 ease-out dark:text-white">
    <header class="mx-auto flex h-[4.5rem] max-w-[--w] px-8 lg:justify-center">
  <div class="relative z-50 ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto flex items-center">
    <a class="-translate-y-[1px] text-2xl font-medium" href="https://blog.ramunasnognys.tech/"
      ></a
    >
    <div
      class="btn-dark text-[0] ltr:ml-4 rtl:mr-4 h-6 w-6 shrink-0 cursor-pointer [background:url(./theme.svg)_left_center/cover_no-repeat] dark:invert dark:[background-position:right]"
      role="button"
      aria-label="Dark"
    ></div>
  </div>

  <div
    class="btn-menu relative z-50 ltr:-mr-8 rtl:-ml-8 flex h-[4.5rem] w-[5rem] shrink-0 cursor-pointer flex-col items-center justify-center gap-2.5 lg:hidden"
    role="button"
    aria-label="Menu"
  ></div>

  

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

    class="nav-wrapper fixed inset-x-0 top-full z-40 flex h-full select-none flex-col justify-center pb-16 duration-200 dark:bg-black lg:static lg:h-auto lg:flex-row lg:!bg-transparent lg:pb-0 lg:transition-none"
  >

This shift represents what systems theorists call a &lt;strong&gt;paradigm transition&lt;/strong&gt;: a moment when established patterns give way to new frameworks of understanding and operation.&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;h2 id=&#34;the-new-development-paradigm&#34;&gt;The New Development Paradigm&lt;/h2&gt;&#xA;&lt;blockquote&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;AI-Enhanced Development&lt;/strong&gt;: A software creation approach that combines human creativity and strategic thinking with AI-powered automation and assistance to accelerate and improve the development process.&lt;/p&gt;</description>

  <div class="relative z-50 ltr:mr-auto rtl:ml-auto flex items-center">
    <a class="-translate-y-[1px] text-2xl font-medium" href="https://blog.ramunasnognys.tech/"
      ></a
    >
    <div
      class="btn-dark text-[0] ltr:ml-4 rtl:mr-4 h-6 w-6 shrink-0 cursor-pointer [background:url(./theme.svg)_left_center/cover_no-repeat] dark:invert dark:[background-position:right]"
      role="button"
      aria-label="Dark"

    class="btn-menu relative z-50 ltr:-mr-8 rtl:-ml-8 flex h-[4.5rem] w-[5rem] shrink-0 cursor-pointer flex-col items-center justify-center gap-2.5 lg:hidden"
    role="button"
    aria-label="Menu"
  ></div>

  

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

  <div
    class="nav-wrapper fixed inset-x-0 top-full z-40 flex h-full select-none flex-col justify-center pb-16 duration-200 dark:bg-black lg:static lg:h-auto lg:flex-row lg:!bg-transparent lg:pb-0 lg:transition-none"
  >
    
    

    
    <nav

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

      class="btn-dark text-[0] ltr:ml-4 rtl:mr-4 h-6 w-6 shrink-0 cursor-pointer [background:url(./theme.svg)_left_center/cover_no-repeat] dark:invert dark:[background-position:right]"
      role="button"
      aria-label="Dark"
    ></div>
  </div>

  <div
    class="btn-menu relative z-50 ltr:-mr-8 rtl:-ml-8 flex h-[4.5rem] w-[5rem] shrink-0 cursor-pointer flex-col items-center justify-center gap-2.5 lg:hidden"
    role="button"
    aria-label="Menu"
  ></div>

  

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

  <div
    class="nav-wrapper fixed inset-x-0 top-full z-40 flex h-full select-none flex-col justify-center pb-16 duration-200 dark:bg-black lg:static lg:h-auto lg:flex-row lg:!bg-transparent lg:pb-0 lg:transition-none"
  >
    
    

    
    <nav
      class="mt-12 flex justify-center space-x-10 rtl:space-x-reverse dark:invert ltr:lg:ml-14 rtl:lg:mr-14 lg:mt-0 lg:items-center"
    >
      
      <a
        class="h-7 w-7 text-[0] [background:var(--url)_center_center/cover_no-repeat] lg:h-6 lg:w-6"

        target="_blank"
        rel="me"
      >

      </a>

        target="_blank"
        rel="me"
      >
        github
      </a>
      
      <a

      <description>&lt;blockquote&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Core Thesis&lt;/strong&gt;: Creating a successful SaaS business requires understanding the intricate interplay between four fundamental systems: market dynamics, product evolution, customer acquisition mechanisms, and value delivery networks.&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;/blockquote&gt;&#xA;&lt;h2 id=&#34;i-systems-level-overview&#34;&gt;I. Systems-Level Overview&lt;/h2&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;Before diving into specifics, let&amp;rsquo;s understand the &lt;strong&gt;meta-framework&lt;/strong&gt; that governs successful SaaS businesses:&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;ol&gt;&#xA;&lt;li&gt;&lt;em&gt;Market Intelligence System&lt;/em&gt;: The continuous feedback loop between market research, validation, and strategic positioning&lt;/li&gt;&#xA;&lt;li&gt;&lt;em&gt;Product Development Ecosystem&lt;/em&gt;: The iterative cycle of building, measuring, and learning&lt;/li&gt;&#xA;&lt;li&gt;&lt;em&gt;Growth Engine&lt;/em&gt;: The integrated network of marketing, sales, and acquisition channels&lt;/li&gt;&#xA;&lt;li&gt;&lt;em&gt;Value Retention Framework&lt;/em&gt;: The mechanisms that ensure sustained customer success and loyalty&lt;/li&gt;&#xA;&lt;/ol&gt;&#xA;&lt;h2 id=&#34;ii-market-intelligence-system-deep-dive&#34;&gt;II. Market Intelligence System: Deep Dive&lt;/h2&gt;&#xA;&lt;h3 id=&#34;understanding-market-dynamics-through-systematic-validation&#34;&gt;Understanding Market Dynamics Through &lt;strong&gt;Systematic Validation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;The foundation of SaaS success lies in developing what I call a &amp;ldquo;validation framework&amp;rdquo; - a structured approach to market understanding that operates across three dimensions:&lt;/p&gt;</description>

      <title>The Architecture of SaaS Success A Systems Approach to Building Sustainable Software Businesses</title>
      <link>https://blog.ramunasnognys.tech/posts/the-architecture-of-saas-success-a-systems-approach-to-building-sustainable-software-businesses/</link>
      <pubDate>Fri, 10 Jan 2025 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid>https://blog.ramunasnognys.tech/posts/the-architecture-of-saas-success-a-systems-approach-to-building-sustainable-software-businesses/</guid>
      <description>&lt;blockquote&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Core Thesis&lt;/strong&gt;: Creating a successful SaaS business requires understanding the intricate interplay between four fundamental systems: market dynamics, product evolution, customer acquisition mechanisms, and value delivery networks.&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;/blockquote&gt;&#xA;&lt;h2 id=&#34;i-systems-level-overview&#34;&gt;I. Systems-Level Overview&lt;/h2&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;Before diving into specifics, let&amp;rsquo;s understand the &lt;strong&gt;meta-framework&lt;/strong&gt; that governs successful SaaS businesses:&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;ol&gt;&#xA;&lt;li&gt;&lt;em&gt;Market Intelligence System&lt;/em&gt;: The continuous feedback loop between market research, validation, and strategic positioning&lt;/li&gt;&#xA;&lt;li&gt;&lt;em&gt;Product Development Ecosystem&lt;/em&gt;: The iterative cycle of building, measuring, and learning&lt;/li&gt;&#xA;&lt;li&gt;&lt;em&gt;Growth Engine&lt;/em&gt;: The integrated network of marketing, sales, and acquisition channels&lt;/li&gt;&#xA;&lt;li&gt;&lt;em&gt;Value Retention Framework&lt;/em&gt;: The mechanisms that ensure sustained customer success and loyalty&lt;/li&gt;&#xA;&lt;/ol&gt;&#xA;&lt;h2 id=&#34;ii-market-intelligence-system-deep-dive&#34;&gt;II. Market Intelligence System: Deep Dive&lt;/h2&gt;&#xA;&lt;h3 id=&#34;understanding-market-dynamics-through-systematic-validation&#34;&gt;Understanding Market Dynamics Through &lt;strong&gt;Systematic Validation&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/h3&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;The foundation of SaaS success lies in developing what I call a &amp;ldquo;validation framework&amp;rdquo; - a structured approach to market understanding that operates across three dimensions:&lt;/p&gt;</description>

    <item>
      <title>By default, capital will matter more than ever after AGI</title>
      <link>https://blog.ramunasnognys.tech/posts/by-default-capital-will-matter-more-than-ever-after-agi/</link>
      <pubDate>Wed, 08 Jan 2025 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid>https://blog.ramunasnognys.tech/posts/by-default-capital-will-matter-more-than-ever-after-agi/</guid>
      <description>&lt;p&gt;by &lt;a href=&#34;https://www.lesswrong.com/users/l-rudolf-l?from=post_header&#34;&gt;L Rudolf L&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;28th Dec 2024&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;&lt;a href=&#34;https://www.lesswrong.com/out?url=https%3A%2F%2Fnosetgauge.substack.com%2Fp%2Fcapital-agi-and-human-ambition&#34;&gt;Linkpost from nosetgauge.substack.com&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;&lt;em&gt;This post is crossposted from my Substack. Original&lt;/em&gt; &lt;a href=&#34;https://nosetgauge.substack.com/p/capital-agi-and-human-ambition&#34;&gt;&lt;em&gt;here&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/a&gt;.&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Edited to add&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;em&gt;&lt;strong&gt;:&lt;/strong&gt; The main takeaway of this post is meant to be: &lt;strong&gt;Labour-replacing AI will shift the relative importance of human v non-human factors of production, which reduces the incentives for society to care about humans while making existing powers more effective and entrenched.&lt;/strong&gt; Many people are reading this post in a way where either (a) &amp;ldquo;capital&amp;rdquo; means just &amp;ldquo;money&amp;rdquo; (rather than also including physical capital like factories and data centres), or (b) the main concern is human-human inequality (rather than broader societal concerns about humanity&amp;rsquo;s collective position, the potential for social change, and human agency).&lt;/em&gt;&lt;/p&gt;</description>
    </item>

Nullam a erat felis. Vestibulum nec diam ac nisi pharetra tincidunt. Ut vitae ullamcorper ipsum. Sed vehicula vehicula dolor. Quisque ac tortor a neque scelerisque venenatis.&lt;/p&gt;</description>

    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');

    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');

    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');

      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');

      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);

      setDark(event.matches);

      <pubDate>Tue, 07 Jan 2025 00:00:00 +0000</pubDate>
      <guid>https://blog.ramunasnognys.tech/posts/my-insane-blog-post/</guid>
      <description>&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=&#34;https://blog.ramunasnognys.tech/images/Pasted%20image%2020250108062918.png&#34; alt=&#34;Pasted image 20250108062918.png&#34;&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=&#34;https://blog.ramunasnognys.tech/images/Pasted%20image%2020250108063711.png&#34; alt=&#34;Pasted image 20250108063711.png&#34;&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;&lt;img src=&#34;https://blog.ramunasnognys.tech/images/Pasted%20image%2020250108064310.png&#34; alt=&#34;Pasted image 20250108064310.png&#34;&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;h2 id=&#34;introduction&#34;&gt;Introduction&lt;/h2&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;After watching an inspiring video about starting a blog in 2024, I realized something profound: &amp;ldquo;my mind is for having ideas, not holding them.&amp;rdquo; This quote from Tiago Forte&amp;rsquo;s &amp;ldquo;Building a Second Brain&amp;rdquo; hit me hard. We&amp;rsquo;re drowning in information but starving for wisdom. That&amp;rsquo;s why I decided to start this blog—not just as another voice on the internet, but as a way to process, organize, and share my journey of learning and growth.&lt;/p&gt;</description>

      aria-label="Dark"

    role="button"
    aria-label="Menu"
  ></div>

  

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

  <div
    class="nav-wrapper fixed inset-x-0 top-full z-40 flex h-full select-none flex-col justify-center pb-16 duration-200 dark:bg-black lg:static lg:h-auto lg:flex-row lg:!bg-transparent lg:pb-0 lg:transition-none"
  >

      ></a

    <div
      class="btn-dark text-[0] ltr:ml-4 rtl:mr-4 h-6 w-6 shrink-0 cursor-pointer [background:url(./theme.svg)_left_center/cover_no-repeat] dark:invert dark:[background-position:right]"

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

  <div
    class="nav-wrapper fixed inset-x-0 top-full z-40 flex h-full select-none flex-col justify-center pb-16 duration-200 dark:bg-black lg:static lg:h-auto lg:flex-row lg:!bg-transparent lg:pb-0 lg:transition-none"
  >

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

      <description>&lt;p&gt;The landscape of software development is undergoing a fundamental transformation. As we navigate through 2025, artificial intelligence isn&amp;rsquo;t just another tool in a developer&amp;rsquo;s toolkit—it&amp;rsquo;s reshaping the entire development ecosystem. This shift represents what systems theorists call a &lt;strong&gt;paradigm transition&lt;/strong&gt;: a moment when established patterns give way to new frameworks of understanding and operation.&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;h2 id=&#34;the-new-development-paradigm&#34;&gt;The New Development Paradigm&lt;/h2&gt;&#xA;&lt;blockquote&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;AI-Enhanced Development&lt;/strong&gt;: A software creation approach that combines human creativity and strategic thinking with AI-powered automation and assistance to accelerate and improve the development process.&lt;/p&gt;</description>

  </channel>

    class="btn-menu relative z-50 ltr:-mr-8 rtl:-ml-8 flex h-[4.5rem] w-[5rem] shrink-0 cursor-pointer flex-col items-center justify-center gap-2.5 lg:hidden"
    role="button"
    aria-label="Menu"
  ></div>

  

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

  <div
    class="nav-wrapper fixed inset-x-0 top-full z-40 flex h-full select-none flex-col justify-center pb-16 duration-200 dark:bg-black lg:static lg:h-auto lg:flex-row lg:!bg-transparent lg:pb-0 lg:transition-none"
  >
    
    

    
    <nav
      class="mt-12 flex justify-center space-x-10 rtl:space-x-reverse dark:invert ltr:lg:ml-14 rtl:lg:mr-14 lg:mt-0 lg:items-center"
    >

    role="button"
    aria-label="Menu"
  ></div>

  

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

  <div
    class="nav-wrapper fixed inset-x-0 top-full z-40 flex h-full select-none flex-col justify-center pb-16 duration-200 dark:bg-black lg:static lg:h-auto lg:flex-row lg:!bg-transparent lg:pb-0 lg:transition-none"
  >
    
    

    
    <nav
      class="mt-12 flex justify-center space-x-10 rtl:space-x-reverse dark:invert ltr:lg:ml-14 rtl:lg:mr-14 lg:mt-0 lg:items-center"

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

      class="btn-dark text-[0] ltr:ml-4 rtl:mr-4 h-6 w-6 shrink-0 cursor-pointer [background:url(./theme.svg)_left_center/cover_no-repeat] dark:invert dark:[background-position:right]"
      role="button"
      aria-label="Dark"
    ></div>
  </div>

  <div
    class="btn-menu relative z-50 ltr:-mr-8 rtl:-ml-8 flex h-[4.5rem] w-[5rem] shrink-0 cursor-pointer flex-col items-center justify-center gap-2.5 lg:hidden"
    role="button"
    aria-label="Menu"
  ></div>

  

  <script>
    
    const htmlClass = document.documentElement.classList;
    setTimeout(() => {
      htmlClass.remove('not-ready');
    }, 10);

    
    const btnMenu = document.querySelector('.btn-menu');
    btnMenu.addEventListener('click', () => {
      htmlClass.toggle('open');
    });

    
    const metaTheme = document.querySelector('meta[name="theme-color"]');
    const lightBg = '#faf8f1'.replace(/"/g, '');
    const setDark = (isDark) => {
      metaTheme.setAttribute('content', isDark ? '#000' : lightBg);
      htmlClass[isDark ? 'add' : 'remove']('dark');
      localStorage.setItem('dark', isDark);
    };

    
    const darkScheme = window.matchMedia('(prefers-color-scheme: dark)');
    if (htmlClass.contains('dark')) {
      setDark(true);
    } else {
      const darkVal = localStorage.getItem('dark');
      setDark(darkVal ? darkVal === 'true' : darkScheme.matches);
    }

    
    darkScheme.addEventListener('change', (event) => {
      setDark(event.matches);
    });

    
    const btnDark = document.querySelector('.btn-dark');
    btnDark.addEventListener('click', () => {
      setDark(localStorage.getItem('dark') !== 'true');
    });
  </script>

  <div
    class="nav-wrapper fixed inset-x-0 top-full z-40 flex h-full select-none flex-col justify-center pb-16 duration-200 dark:bg-black lg:static lg:h-auto lg:flex-row lg:!bg-transparent lg:pb-0 lg:transition-none"
  >

As we navigate through 2025, artificial intelligence isn&amp;rsquo;t just another tool in a developer&amp;rsquo;s toolkit—it&amp;rsquo;s reshaping the entire development ecosystem. This shift represents what systems theorists call a &lt;strong&gt;paradigm transition&lt;/strong&gt;: a moment when established patterns give way to new frameworks of understanding and operation.&lt;/p&gt;&#xA;&lt;h2 id=&#34;the-new-development-paradigm&#34;&gt;The New Development Paradigm&lt;/h2&gt;&#xA;&lt;blockquote&gt;&#xA;&lt;p&gt;&lt;strong&gt;AI-Enhanced Development&lt;/strong&gt;: A software creation approach that combines human creativity and strategic thinking with AI-powered automation and assistance to accelerate and improve the development process.&lt;/p&gt;</description>

## File: themes/paper/assets/app.css
```css
/*
 * Paper
 * A simple, clean, flexible Hugo theme
 * https://github.com/nanxiaobei/hugo-paper
 * Designed by 南小北 https://lee.so/
 */

@tailwind base;
@tailwind components;
@tailwind utilities;

@layer base {
  :root {
    --w: calc(680px + 32px * 2);
  }

  body {
    @apply bg-[--bg] antialiased [-webkit-tap-highlight-color:transparent];

    @apply dark:before:fixed dark:before:inset-0 dark:before:bg-black/85;
  }

  h1,
  h2,
  h3 {
    @apply !font-semibold;
  }

  pre {
    direction: ltr;
  }
}

@layer components {
  .btn {
    @apply rounded-xl bg-black px-5 py-3 text-[0.95em] text-white no-underline duration-100 active:scale-95 dark:bg-white dark:text-black;
  }

  .link {
    @apply duration-200 hover:text-black dark:hover:text-white;
  }
}

@layer utilities {
  .not-ready * {
    @apply !transition-none;
  }

  .prose {
    @apply break-words;
  }

  .prose kbd:has(kbd) {
    @apply shadow-none;
  }

  .btn-menu::before,
  .btn-menu::after {
    @apply block h-[2px] w-5 bg-black duration-200 content-[''] dark:invert;
  }

  .nav-wrapper {
    background: var(--bg);
  }

  .open {
    @apply overflow-hidden;
  }

  .open .btn-menu::before {
    @apply w-6 translate-y-[5.5px] rotate-45;
  }

  .open .btn-menu::after {
    @apply w-6 -translate-y-[5.5px] -rotate-45;
  }

  .open .nav-wrapper {
    @apply top-0;
  }

  article {
    @apply text-lg leading-[1.8] text-black dark:text-white;
  }

  article code {
    @apply inline-block !text-sm !leading-6;
  }

  article .highlight {
    @apply my-8;

    pre {
      @apply my-0;
    }

    > div {
      @apply rounded-md bg-[--tw-prose-pre-bg];

      table {
        @apply my-0 table-fixed;

        tr {
          @apply flex;

          td {
            @apply p-0;

            pre {
              @apply !bg-transparent;
            }
          }

          &:first-of-type pre {
            @apply pr-[4px];

            code span {
              @apply !mr-0 block min-w-[18px] !p-0 text-right text-white/40;
            }
          }

          &:last-of-type {
            @apply overflow-auto;
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}
```

## File: themes/paper/assets/main.css
```css
/*
 * Paper
 * A simple, clean, flexible Hugo theme
 * https://github.com/nanxiaobei/hugo-paper
 * Designed by 南小北 https://lee.so/
 */

/*
 ! tailwindcss v3.4.10 | MIT License | https://tailwindcss.com
 */

/*
1. Prevent padding and border from affecting element width. (https://github.com/mozdevs/cssremedy/issues/4)
2. Allow adding a border to an element by just adding a border-width. (https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/pull/116)
*/

*,
::before,
::after {
  box-sizing: border-box;
  /* 1 */
  border-width: 0;
  /* 2 */
  border-style: solid;
  /* 2 */
  border-color: #e5e7eb;
  /* 2 */
}

::before,
::after {
  --tw-content: '';
}

/*
1. Use a consistent sensible line-height in all browsers.
2. Prevent adjustments of font size after orientation changes in iOS.
3. Use a more readable tab size.
4. Use the user's configured `sans` font-family by default.
5. Use the user's configured `sans` font-feature-settings by default.
6. Use the user's configured `sans` font-variation-settings by default.
7. Disable tap highlights on iOS
*/

html,
:host {
  line-height: 1.5;
  /* 1 */
  -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%;
  /* 2 */
  -moz-tab-size: 4;
  /* 3 */
  -o-tab-size: 4;
     tab-size: 4;
  /* 3 */
  font-family: ui-sans-serif, system-ui, sans-serif, "Apple Color Emoji", "Segoe UI Emoji", "Segoe UI Symbol", "Noto Color Emoji";
  /* 4 */
  font-feature-settings: normal;
  /* 5 */
  font-variation-settings: normal;
  /* 6 */
  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;
  /* 7 */
}

/*
1. Remove the margin in all browsers.
2. Inherit line-height from `html` so users can set them as a class directly on the `html` element.
*/

body {
  margin: 0;
  /* 1 */
  line-height: inherit;
  /* 2 */
}

/*
1. Add the correct height in Firefox.
2. Correct the inheritance of border color in Firefox. (https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=190655)
3. Ensure horizontal rules are visible by default.
*/

hr {
  height: 0;
  /* 1 */
  color: inherit;
  /* 2 */
  border-top-width: 1px;
  /* 3 */
}

/*
Add the correct text decoration in Chrome, Edge, and Safari.
*/

abbr:where([title]) {
  -webkit-text-decoration: underline dotted;
          text-decoration: underline dotted;
}

/*
Remove the default font size and weight for headings.
*/

h1,
h2,
h3,
h4,
h5,
h6 {
  font-size: inherit;
  font-weight: inherit;
}

/*
Reset links to optimize for opt-in styling instead of opt-out.
*/

a {
  color: inherit;
  text-decoration: inherit;
}

/*
Add the correct font weight in Edge and Safari.
*/

b,
strong {
  font-weight: bolder;
}

/*
1. Use the user's configured `mono` font-family by default.
2. Use the user's configured `mono` font-feature-settings by default.
3. Use the user's configured `mono` font-variation-settings by default.
4. Correct the odd `em` font sizing in all browsers.
*/

code,
kbd,
samp,
pre {
  font-family: ui-monospace, SFMono-Regular, Menlo, Monaco, Consolas, "Liberation Mono", "Courier New", monospace;
  /* 1 */
  font-feature-settings: normal;
  /* 2 */
  font-variation-settings: normal;
  /* 3 */
  font-size: 1em;
  /* 4 */
}

/*
Add the correct font size in all browsers.
*/

small {
  font-size: 80%;
}

/*
Prevent `sub` and `sup` elements from affecting the line height in all browsers.
*/

sub,
sup {
  font-size: 75%;
  line-height: 0;
  position: relative;
  vertical-align: baseline;
}

sub {
  bottom: -0.25em;
}

sup {
  top: -0.5em;
}

/*
1. Remove text indentation from table contents in Chrome and Safari. (https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=999088, https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=201297)
2. Correct table border color inheritance in all Chrome and Safari. (https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=935729, https://bugs.webkit.org/show_bug.cgi?id=195016)
3. Remove gaps between table borders by default.
*/

table {
  text-indent: 0;
  /* 1 */
  border-color: inherit;
  /* 2 */
  border-collapse: collapse;
  /* 3 */
}

/*
1. Change the font styles in all browsers.
2. Remove the margin in Firefox and Safari.
3. Remove default padding in all browsers.
*/

button,
input,
optgroup,
select,
textarea {
  font-family: inherit;
  /* 1 */
  font-feature-settings: inherit;
  /* 1 */
  font-variation-settings: inherit;
  /* 1 */
  font-size: 100%;
  /* 1 */
  font-weight: inherit;
  /* 1 */
  line-height: inherit;
  /* 1 */
  letter-spacing: inherit;
  /* 1 */
  color: inherit;
  /* 1 */
  margin: 0;
  /* 2 */
  padding: 0;
  /* 3 */
}

/*
Remove the inheritance of text transform in Edge and Firefox.
*/

button,
select {
  text-transform: none;
}

/*
1. Correct the inability to style clickable types in iOS and Safari.
2. Remove default button styles.
*/

button,
input:where([type='button']),
input:where([type='reset']),
input:where([type='submit']) {
  -webkit-appearance: button;
  /* 1 */
  background-color: transparent;
  /* 2 */
  background-image: none;
  /* 2 */
}

/*
Use the modern Firefox focus style for all focusable elements.
*/

:-moz-focusring {
  outline: auto;
}

/*
Remove the additional `:invalid` styles in Firefox. (https://github.com/mozilla/gecko-dev/blob/2f9eacd9d3d995c937b4251a5557d95d494c9be1/layout/style/res/forms.css#L728-L737)
*/

:-moz-ui-invalid {
  box-shadow: none;
}

/*
Add the correct vertical alignment in Chrome and Firefox.
*/

progress {
  vertical-align: baseline;
}

/*
Correct the cursor style of increment and decrement buttons in Safari.
*/

::-webkit-inner-spin-button,
::-webkit-outer-spin-button {
  height: auto;
}

/*
1. Correct the odd appearance in Chrome and Safari.
2. Correct the outline style in Safari.
*/

[type='search'] {
  -webkit-appearance: textfield;
  /* 1 */
  outline-offset: -2px;
  /* 2 */
}

/*
Remove the inner padding in Chrome and Safari on macOS.
*/

::-webkit-search-decoration {
  -webkit-appearance: none;
}

/*
1. Correct the inability to style clickable types in iOS and Safari.
2. Change font properties to `inherit` in Safari.
*/

::-webkit-file-upload-button {
  -webkit-appearance: button;
  /* 1 */
  font: inherit;
  /* 2 */
}

/*
Add the correct display in Chrome and Safari.
*/

summary {
  display: list-item;
}

/*
Removes the default spacing and border for appropriate elements.
*/

blockquote,
dl,
dd,
h1,
h2,
h3,
h4,
h5,
h6,
hr,
figure,
p,
pre {
  margin: 0;
}

fieldset {
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
}

legend {
  padding: 0;
}

ol,
ul,
menu {
  list-style: none;
  margin: 0;
  padding: 0;
}

/*
Reset default styling for dialogs.
*/

dialog {
  padding: 0;
}

/*
Prevent resizing textareas horizontally by default.
*/

textarea {
  resize: vertical;
}

/*
1. Reset the default placeholder opacity in Firefox. (https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/issues/3300)
2. Set the default placeholder color to the user's configured gray 400 color.
*/

input::-moz-placeholder, textarea::-moz-placeholder {
  opacity: 1;
  /* 1 */
  color: #9ca3af;
  /* 2 */
}

input::placeholder,
textarea::placeholder {
  opacity: 1;
  /* 1 */
  color: #9ca3af;
  /* 2 */
}

/*
Set the default cursor for buttons.
*/

button,
[role="button"] {
  cursor: pointer;
}

/*
Make sure disabled buttons don't get the pointer cursor.
*/

:disabled {
  cursor: default;
}

/*
1. Make replaced elements `display: block` by default. (https://github.com/mozdevs/cssremedy/issues/14)
2. Add `vertical-align: middle` to align replaced elements more sensibly by default. (https://github.com/jensimmons/cssremedy/issues/14#issuecomment-634934210)
   This can trigger a poorly considered lint error in some tools but is included by design.
*/

img,
svg,
video,
canvas,
audio,
iframe,
embed,
object {
  display: block;
  /* 1 */
  vertical-align: middle;
  /* 2 */
}

/*
Constrain images and videos to the parent width and preserve their intrinsic aspect ratio. (https://github.com/mozdevs/cssremedy/issues/14)
*/

img,
video {
  max-width: 100%;
  height: auto;
}

/* Make elements with the HTML hidden attribute stay hidden by default */

[hidden] {
  display: none;
}

  --w: calc(680px + 32px * 2);

.ltr\:ml-4:where([dir="ltr"], [dir="ltr"] *) {
  margin-left: 1rem;
}

.ltr\:ml-auto:where([dir="ltr"], [dir="ltr"] *) {
  margin-left: auto;
}

.ltr\:mr-1\.5:where([dir="ltr"], [dir="ltr"] *) {
  margin-right: 0.375rem;
}

.ltr\:mr-5:where([dir="ltr"], [dir="ltr"] *) {
  margin-right: 1.25rem;
}

}

}

  }

  .ltr\:lg\:ml-12:where([dir="ltr"], [dir="ltr"] *) {

  }
}

}

  margin-right: -0.25rem;
}

## File: themes/paper/exampleSite/content/about.md
```markdown
+++
title = "About"
description = "Hugo, the world's fastest framework for building websites"
date = "2019-02-28"
aliases = ["about-us", "about-hugo", "contact"]
author = "lee.so"
+++

Written in Go, Hugo is an open source static site generator available under the [Apache Licence 2.0.](https://github.com/gohugoio/hugo/blob/master/LICENSE) Hugo supports TOML, YAML and JSON data file types, Markdown and HTML content files and uses shortcodes to add rich content. Other notable features are taxonomies, multilingual mode, image processing, custom output formats, HTML/CSS/JS minification and support for Sass SCSS workflows.

Hugo makes use of a variety of open source projects including:

- https://github.com/yuin/goldmark
- https://github.com/alecthomas/chroma
- https://github.com/muesli/smartcrop
- https://github.com/spf13/cobra
- https://github.com/spf13/viper

Hugo is ideal for blogs, corporate websites, creative portfolios, online magazines, single page applications or even a website with thousands of pages.

Hugo is for people who want to hand code their own website without worrying about setting up complicated runtimes, dependencies and databases.

Websites built with Hugo are extremely fast, secure and can be deployed anywhere including, AWS, GitHub Pages, Heroku, Netlify and any other hosting provider.

Learn more and contribute on [GitHub](https://github.com/gohugoio).
```

## File: themes/paper/exampleSite/content/post/emoji-support.md
```markdown
+++
author = "lee.so"
title = "Emoji Support"
date = "2019-03-05"
description = "Guide to emoji usage in Hugo"
tags = [
    "emoji",
]
+++

Emoji can be enabled in a Hugo project in a number of ways.

<!--more-->

The [`emojify`](https://gohugo.io/functions/emojify/) function can be called directly in templates or [Inline Shortcodes](https://gohugo.io/templates/shortcode-templates/#inline-shortcodes).

To enable emoji globally, set `enableEmoji` to `true` in your site's [configuration](https://gohugo.io/getting-started/configuration/) and then you can type emoji shorthand codes directly in content files; e.g.

<p><span class="nowrap"><span class="emojify">🙈</span> <code>:see_no_evil:</code></span>  <span class="nowrap"><span class="emojify">🙉</span> <code>:hear_no_evil:</code></span>  <span class="nowrap"><span class="emojify">🙊</span> <code>:speak_no_evil:</code></span></p>
<br>

The [Emoji cheat sheet](http://www.emoji-cheat-sheet.com/) is a useful reference for emoji shorthand codes.

---

**N.B.** The above steps enable Unicode Standard emoji characters and sequences in Hugo, however the rendering of these glyphs depends on the browser and the platform. To style the emoji you can either use a third party emoji font or a font stack; e.g.

{{< highlight html >}}
.emoji {
font-family: Apple Color Emoji, Segoe UI Emoji, NotoColorEmoji, Segoe UI Symbol, Android Emoji, EmojiSymbols;
}
{{< /highlight >}}

{{< css.inline >}}

<style>
.emojify {
	font-family: Apple Color Emoji, Segoe UI Emoji, NotoColorEmoji, Segoe UI Symbol, Android Emoji, EmojiSymbols;
	font-size: 2rem;
	vertical-align: middle;
}
@media screen and (max-width:650px) {
  .nowrap {
    display: block;
    margin: 25px 0;
  }
}
</style>

{{< /css.inline >}}
```

## File: themes/paper/exampleSite/content/post/markdown-syntax.md
```markdown
+++
author = "lee.so"
title = "Markdown Syntax Guide"
date = "2019-03-11"
description = "Sample article showcasing basic Markdown syntax and formatting for HTML elements."
tags = [
    "markdown",
    "css",
    "html",
]
categories = [
    "themes",
    "syntax",
]
series = ["Themes Guide"]
aliases = ["migrate-from-jekyl"]
+++

This article offers a sample of basic Markdown syntax that can be used in Hugo content files, also it shows whether basic HTML elements are decorated with CSS in a Hugo theme.

<!--more-->

## Headings

The following HTML `<h1>`—`<h6>` elements represent six levels of section headings. `<h1>` is the highest section level while `<h6>` is the lowest.

# H1

## H2

### H3

#### H4

##### H5

###### H6

## Paragraph

Xerum, quo qui aut unt expliquam qui dolut labo. Aque venitatiusda cum, voluptionse latur sitiae dolessi aut parist aut dollo enim qui voluptate ma dolestendit peritin re plis aut quas inctum laceat est volestemque commosa as cus endigna tectur, offic to cor sequas etum rerum idem sintibus eiur? Quianimin porecus evelectur, cum que nis nust voloribus ratem aut omnimi, sitatur? Quiatem. Nam, omnis sum am facea corem alique molestrunt et eos evelece arcillit ut aut eos eos nus, sin conecerem erum fuga. Ri oditatquam, ad quibus unda veliamenimin cusam et facea ipsamus es exerum sitate dolores editium rerore eost, temped molorro ratiae volorro te reribus dolorer sperchicium faceata tiustia prat.

Itatur? Quiatae cullecum rem ent aut odis in re eossequodi nonsequ idebis ne sapicia is sinveli squiatum, core et que aut hariosam ex eat.

## Blockquotes

The blockquote element represents content that is quoted from another source, optionally with a citation which must be within a `footer` or `cite` element, and optionally with in-line changes such as annotations and abbreviations.

#### Blockquote without attribution

> Tiam, ad mint andaepu dandae nostion secatur sequo quae.
> **Note** that you can use _Markdown syntax_ within a blockquote.

#### Blockquote with attribution

> Don't communicate by sharing memory, share memory by communicating.<br>
> — <cite>Rob Pike[^1]</cite>

[^1]: The above quote is excerpted from Rob Pike's [talk](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PAAkCSZUG1c) during Gopherfest, November 18, 2015.

## Tables

Tables aren't part of the core Markdown spec, but Hugo supports supports them out-of-the-box.

| Name  | Age |
| ----- | --- |
| Bob   | 27  |
| Alice | 23  |

#### Inline Markdown within tables

| Italics   | Bold     | Code   |
| --------- | -------- | ------ |
| _italics_ | **bold** | `code` |

## Code Blocks

#### Code block with backticks

```html
<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
  <head>
    <meta charset="utf-8" />
    <title>Example HTML5 Document</title>
  </head>
  <body>
    <p>Test</p>
  </body>
</html>
```

#### Code block indented with four spaces

    <!doctype html>
    <html lang="en">
    <head>
      <meta charset="utf-8">
      <title>Example HTML5 Document</title>
    </head>
    <body>
      <p>Test</p>
    </body>
    </html>

#### Code block with Hugo's internal highlight shortcode

{{< highlight html >}}

<!doctype html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <title>Example HTML5 Document</title>
</head>
<body>
  <p>Test</p>
</body>
</html>
{{< /highlight >}}

## List Types

#### Ordered List

1. First item
2. Second item
3. Third item

#### Unordered List

- List item
- Another item
- And another item

#### Nested list

- Fruit
  - Apple
  - Orange
  - Banana
- Dairy
  - Milk
  - Cheese

## Other Elements — abbr, sub, sup, kbd, mark

<abbr title="Graphics Interchange Format">GIF</abbr> is a bitmap image format.

H<sub>2</sub>O

X<sup>n</sup> + Y<sup>n</sup> = Z<sup>n</sup>

Press <kbd><kbd>CTRL</kbd>+<kbd>ALT</kbd>+<kbd>Delete</kbd></kbd> to end the session.

Most <mark>salamanders</mark> are nocturnal, and hunt for insects, worms, and other small creatures.
```

## File: themes/paper/exampleSite/content/post/math-typesetting.md
```markdown
---
author: lee.so
title: Math Typesetting
date: 2019-03-08
description: A brief guide to setup KaTeX
math: true
---

Mathematical notation in a Hugo project can be enabled by using third party JavaScript libraries.

<!--more-->

In this example we will be using [KaTeX](https://katex.org/)

- Create a partial under `/layouts/partials/math.html`
- Within this partial reference the [Auto-render Extension](https://katex.org/docs/autorender.html) or host these scripts locally.
- Include the partial in your templates like so:

```bash
{{ if or .Params.math .Site.Params.math }}
{{ partial "math.html" . }}
{{ end }}
```

- To enable KaTeX globally set the parameter `math` to `true` in a project's configuration
- To enable KaTeX on a per page basis include the parameter `math: true` in content files

**Note:** Use the online reference of [Supported TeX Functions](https://katex.org/docs/supported.html)

{{< math.inline >}}

{{</ math.inline >}}

### Examples

{{< math.inline >}}

<p>
Inline math: \(\varphi = \dfrac{1+\sqrt5}{2}= 1.6180339887…\)
</p>

{{</ math.inline >}}

Block math:

$$
 \varphi = 1+\frac{1} {1+\frac{1} {1+\frac{1} {1+\cdots} } }
$$
```

## File: themes/paper/exampleSite/README.md
```markdown
# hugoBasicExample

This repository offers an example site for [Hugo](https://gohugo.io/) and also it provides the default content for demos hosted on the [Hugo Themes Showcase](https://themes.gohugo.io/).

# Using

1. [Install Hugo](https://gohugo.io/overview/installing/)
2. Clone this repository

```bash
git clone https://github.com/gohugoio/hugoBasicExample.git
cd hugoBasicExample
```

3. Clone the repository you want to test. If you want to test all Hugo Themes then follow the instructions provided [here](https://github.com/gohugoio/hugoThemes#installing-all-themes)

4. Run Hugo and select the theme of your choosing

```bash
hugo server -t YOURTHEME
```

5. Under `/content/` this repository contains the following:

- A section called `/post/` with sample markdown content
- A headless bundle called `homepage` that you may want to use for single page applications. You can find instructions about headless bundles over [here](https://gohugo.io/content-management/page-bundles/#headless-bundle)
- An `about.md` that is intended to provide the `/about/` page for a theme demo

6. If you intend to build a theme that does not fit in the content structure provided in this repository, then you are still more than welcome to submit it for review at the [Hugo Themes](https://github.com/gohugoio/hugoThemes/issues) repository
```
